column5: I am looking for a fishing guide for within 2 hour drive of the GTA. Needs to hold 2-3 person. Any good recommendations?  Looking for ones that will provide some insightful techinques into Walleye or Bass fishing.  thanks.
We used Greg Klatt for walleye in the Kawarthas and he was great - a very successful morning on the lake:  http://www.profishntanglingservices.com/

Greg knows the Kawarthas very well. 3 hrs you can be in Windsor and fish the best walleye waters with no slot size and a 6 fish limit. Walleye season is open and the catch and release season of Michigan bass opened on the wknd.
Paul Castelano is one of the best bass fishermen that I have ever had the pleasure of fishing with. http://www.castadventures.ca/ Darcy
Bay of Quinte for big Walleye.. Lloyd Daume - U & Me Charters. Check the business section, he even had a special offer for OFC'rs going on..
i HIGHLY recommend bob devine! spent the weekend in windsor fishing walleyes with him, hes a great guy to spend a day on the water with and will put u on fish!
Yup give Bob a call. Pretty tough to find bigger walleye/muskie/bass than the Detroit River/Lake St. Clair waters.
All of the above have great reputations, and you can't go wrong. I'll add one more though - look into Taro Murata from Fish City Tours.
i second paul castellano. hell of a guide!
He really is.  I consider myself a pretty good angler, but he really blew me away. Can't wait, heading out with him on Sunday for some May steelhead action! Darcy

All great suggestions... Simon Frost is another phenomenal guide for Lake Erie smallmouth... and guides on other waters as well but would highly recommend a day with Simon on Erie. Simon Frost Charters  JP
